Build a treehouse: With no clothes to provide insulation, a treehouse would be an excellent way to stay protected from the elements. I would use durable materials like wood and tarps to construct the structure, and plant vines or other climbing plants around it to provide additional support and camouflage. Confidence score: 0.8

I would also use a waterproofing agent like beeswax or tree resin to protect the structure from the elements. Confidence score: 0.7

Utilize a debris hut: With no clothes to use as a building material, I would gather fallen branches, leaves, and other debris to construct a dome-shaped hut. The debris would provide natural insulation, and I would use vines or other climbing plants to hold the structure together. Confidence score: 0.6

Use a burrow: If I were in a wooded area, I would dig a burrow into the ground to protect myself from the elements. I would line the burrow with leaves, grasses, and other natural materials to provide insulation and comfort. Confidence score: 0.5

Create a windbreak: If I were near a body of water, I would construct a windbreak using large rocks, logs, or other natural materials. The windbreak would provide a barrier between me and the wind, protecting me from the elements. Confidence score: 0.4
